abstract: With fewer than 3,000 residents, Glascock County is not big enough to have its own hospital, jail or Wal-Mart. But for more than 100 years, it had a bank — until late last Friday afternoon, when regulators arrived to shut it down, The New York Times’s Shaila Dewan reported.
lead_paragraph: With fewer than 3,000 residents, Glascock County is not big enough to have its own hospital, jail or Wal-Mart. But for more than 100 years, it had a bank — until late last Friday afternoon, when regulators arrived to shut it down, The New York Times’s Shaila Dewan reported.

headline.main: A Small Town Loses a Pillar: Its Only Bank
